extends java.lang.Object

This implements a MultiTaskPart so users can run a query on all data in the grid

Constructor Detail

GridQuery

public GridQuery(com.ibm.websphere.objectgrid.ObjectGrid ogclient,
                 java.lang.String queryString,
                 int limit)
Construct an instance. It's important that any query parameters or hints be specified using setQueryHints(Map) and setQueryParameters(Map)

Parameters:
ogclient - The objectgrid client to use
queryString - The OGQL query
limit - The maximum number of results to return at once
Method Detail

createTaskForPartition

public SinglePartTask<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> createTaskForPartition(SinglePartTask<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>> previousTask)
This will return a new SingleTaskPart job if there are more blocks within the current partition otherwise it should return null to indicate all data can been consumed for the current partition

Specified by:
createTaskForPartition in interface MultipartTask<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>,java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object>>
Parameters:
previousTask - This is null for the first task in a partition
Returns:
This should return null when a partition is exhausted

getNextResult

public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> getNextResult()
This is just a delegate to the JobExecutor. This can return arrays of zero length. Only a null return indicates the end of the operation.

Returns:
